rationale: The segment reports a specific symptom without using intensifiers or comparatives modifying risk-adjectives.
The segment uses factual language without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment describes a symptom without a moderate verb paired with scale/impact.
No loaded rhetorical question found in the segment.
The segment reports the symptom in the Texas patient without explicit calming language.
The phrase 'The lone symptom' uses the minimiser 'lone' (similar to single) with an implied scale contrast (all possible symptoms).
